column4: i've got a problem that i don't know how to fix. before i freshly install karmic, whenever i plug in a usb device it is automatically mounted but on karmic it is not the case. hope someone could give me help, please
In karmic, does your device show up in the output of 'sudo fdisk -l'  ?
you got my reply?
Right.  That's weird, but at least you can mount things manually.
it is very troublesome for me
it's not supposed to be like that when in jaunty it is not like that
there might be an option in gconf for automounting that is responsible for that.  I can;t think of what else would be doing it.
would you know exactly how?
no.  Look in gconf-editor, or google it even!
ok thanks
the problem still persist on my usb
the usb device is still not automatically mounted even when enabling it on gconf-editor
hmm, did you change anything in gconf?
I don't know how it works beyond that level.  Sorry.
thanks :D
you know anything about gnome-mount?
it's not installed by default on karmic?
is it not?  that's strange.  It should be, I'd have thought.  Install it and see if that does the trick.  IDK anything about it really, but its manpage looks promising
will gnome-mount work even with devicekit-disks?
no idea
or it is only for hal?
the man page in jaunty says it's for HAL
aw.. so there is no guarantee that installing gnome-mount will work since 9.10 is using devicekit-disks and not hal
BTW, stop it with the @ signs please!  This is IRC!
